body_html:
Thanks for answering

Also, your example is not "plain nice matrix multiplication". It is left-side vector multiplication of a matrix with an implicit broadcast.

it is matrix multiplication in the mathematical sense (1,n array with n,m array). Note that result np.dot(a, w) in my example has shape (2,) not (2,1)

body:
Thanks for answering

> Also, your example is not "plain nice matrix multiplication". It is left-side vector multiplication of a matrix with an implicit broadcast.

 it is matrix multiplication in the mathematical sense (1,n array with n,m array). Note that result `np.dot(a, w)` in my example has shape `(2,)` not `(2,1)`
